meanings.definition: A material similar to paper made from the pith of the papyrus plant.
meanings.sent1: The ancient Egyptians wrote on papyruses to record their history.
meanings.sent2: I bought a few papyruses to use for my art project.
meanings.sent3: When the cat knocked over the vase, it landed on the stack of papyruses!
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts flowed like ink on the papyruses of her mind.
meanings.sent5: The papyruses rustled softly in the breeze, whispering ancient tales.

meanings.definition: Plural form of papyrus, referring to multiple sheets of the material.
meanings.sent1: The museum displayed various papyruses from different time periods.
meanings.sent2: She carefully unrolled the delicate papyruses to reveal the intricate drawings.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel used the papyruses as confetti for the forest party.
meanings.sent4: His ideas spread across the papyruses like wildfire, igniting curiosity.
meanings.sent5: The papyruses fluttered down the river, carrying secrets of the past.

meanings.definition: The ancient writing material used in Egypt made from the papyrus plant.
meanings.sent1: Scholars study the ancient papyruses to learn about Egyptian civilization.
meanings.sent2: The pharaoh's decree was written on royal papyruses for all to see.
meanings.sent3: The magician pulled a rabbit out of the papyruses instead of a hat!
meanings.sent4: Her dreams were woven into the papyruses, creating a tapestry of imagination.
meanings.sent5: The papyruses glowed under the moonlight, preserving stories for eternity.
